Reviews.Title: “Boutique Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Travellightandfast
Reviews.Content: Grums has an excellent multilingual staff, amazing spanish buffet breakfast (though I would skip the scrambled eggs--there are many better options) and really nice rooms. There is wireless in the rooms, and two computers in the lobby. The printer was broken, but they were happy to help us print on the staff printer. Downstairs in the spa is a lukewarm pool with various water "features." I wonder if it was supposed to be a hot tub? The location is at the foot of Montjuic, not far from the Funicular and the Parallel Metro stop. We were easily able to walk to the foot of the Ramblas and Columbus monument, and take the bus and subway everywhere else we wanted to go. They are a new (one year old) hotel and are working hard to prove themselves in a tough market. We got a deal for 3 days through Living Social in the US which made it super reasonable. I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, small & cosy”
Reviews.Author: Lynn V Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We only spent 1 night in this hotel, but we absolutely loved the nicely decorated room and the spacious terrace. The hotel was located at only 10 minutes' walk to the Ramblas and next to the Via Parallel, where there were a lot of nice little restaurants. The spa was small but cosy and the staff was friendly and helpful. During our next trip to Barcelona we will certainly stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel to explore Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: jeremy a
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect to explore Barcelona. The room was clean and comfortable,although a kettle would have been good! The pool/spa area is nice and better than expected. Breakfast was reasonable, however probably not worth the extra if not alread included. The walk to La Rambla is 10 minutes, although not ideal at night as it takes you through strange areas. We found the staff helpful and polite. Don't plan on having a meal at night at the hotel as its below average! Overall we enjoyed our stay and would definitely return to Grums

Reviews.Title: “April 2012”
Reviews.Author: AMODonnell
Reviews.Content: Great location, clean public areas and rooms, friendly staff, quiet hotel. Travelled here with my partner last week, and do not have a bad word to say about the hotel. Excellent location near Marina and good access to Metro. Allowed to check in early due to our flight times, and hotel were very accommodating for our wait for late flight from Barcelona. A visit back to Barcelona is a must, so much to see and do there, and this hotel is most certainly one I will have no problem returning too.

Reviews.Title: “da EVITARE !!!!”
Reviews.Author: FrancescoA3
Reviews.Content: Arrived in the afternoon (Saturday) at Grums, management told us that our room was no longer available because a pipe had burst and had flooded the entire first floor and there were other rooms available in hotels, but the next day (Sunday) the room would be available because they would have repaired. What, you do not work on Saturdays and Sundays YES?!?!?!?! At that point we knew we had made a mistake, for if we were going to come back to them the next day, we would be given free use of SPA. So you have booked a room at another hotel ... sending alone on foot, we knew that Barcelona!! what service!! The next day returned to Grums, give us the room .... the room was not random, but the first floor as we were told, but it was the fifth! ok! SPA ... but we went in, did not work (that's why it was free). We went to ask for toilet paper, there was no room .... After two hours, still no one rose up to take the paper (fortunately not were suffering from diarrhea), and went down towards the girl told us so rude. We had booked via BOOKING.COM, to return to Italy we discovered that our knowledge and Grums Hotel BOOKING had canceled our reservation to receive negative judgment on the poor living and treatment received. Except the location, this 4 star hotel, I consider it a three stars (but only cosmetic) and I certainly would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, very polite staff”
Reviews.Author: zelka
Reviews.Content: Our family and friends spent a few days on "Semana Santa" in Barcelona. We booked this hotel via Booking.com and did a good choice. Nice, big and modern furnished rooms and rich buffet breakfast what was very important for the whole day strolling over Barcelona streets. The position of the hotel was also very good, near Ramblas, old port and greeny hill in background with spectacular panoramic view.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: thvid
Reviews.Content: Located just a block from Mont Juic and a 10 mins walk to La Rambla & the harbour it's location is very good. At a (compared to other Barcelona Hotels) very reasonable price it has everything you need (wi-fi included). Breakfast buffet can be bought, but I recommend going to the bakery just next door and buy better breakfast at 1/3 of the price! It also has a decent sized spa area. Very clean, very nice interior and design, friendly staff. However the pillows in the beds are not very good, so if you tend to get a sore neck easily, then bring your own :-)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - good deal”
Reviews.Author: Courtfwilliams
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Grums earlier this month. We used a deal from TravelZoo and got the hotel for 3 nights plus breakfast for half price. It was well worth the price we paid (not sure if I would pay full price). AREA: The hotel is located about a 10 minute from the La Rambla. If you're looking for a hotel in the center of the city - this is not your hotel. The hotel is about a 5 minute walk from the metro and a few local eats - however I would walk the 10 minutes to the La Rambla and those surrounding areas for good food. HOTEL: The staff is very friendly and speak English. Large lobby with computers with free internet. Also a plus is free wifi for all guests. We stayed in a standard room which was a good size and the room and bathroom were clean. The hotel also has an indoor pool and spa area which looks nice (we did not use it). Breakfast is was pretty good. Featured pastries, cereal, selection of cold meats, eggs, bacon and franks. The hotel restaurant/bar opens at 7pm in the evening. We had drinks there our first night as we had a coupon for free drinks - otherwise we probably would not have had drinks there. They do not have a snack menu. I'm not sure if they actually serve dinner as we did not inquire. All in all a good hotel for the price that we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed!”
Reviews.Author: morhousedog
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a three night break staying at this hotel. I was extremely disappointed. When we checked into the hotel we were greeted by a nice young man, who was wearing a trainee badge, he was helped by a male receptionist who allocated our room, I politely ask if there was a choice of room, he shrugs his shoulders and said a double room is a double room! He gave us very limited information regarding the hotel, compare to other guests when checking in. The room was so small, dark and standard of cleanliness was not at all good. The bathroom was so small it was really awkward to use, the toilet smelt and the toilet roll holder was broken, the roll was just stuck on the end, which constantly kept falling off. That night we discovered that sheets stunk of cigarettes,one good thing is they did seem to change them daily. The next day we left at 9.30 am and returned at 6.30pm,they had just started to clean our room!! I spoke to reception, they just said "Sorry" and that was it. It was only then we discover the bar, the bar man completely ignored us, we had to get up and walk over and speak to him. I just assumed all of the rooms were like this as I had been told on checking in, on the last day I saw other door open and the rooms were extremely spacious, so I strongly advise guests to check before the accept a room. I travel usually four times a year and this is the first time I have written a negative review on trip advisor. The all round experience of this hotel has certainly left me not having enjoyed my holiday as I should have.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice place, good value.”
Reviews.Author: cat m
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here a couple of weeks ago and thoroughly enjoyed it. We grabbed a cheap deal from lastminute.com. We had a twin room (very clean tidy), access to the Spa area and full buffet breakfast everyday. We also had a free welcome drink accompanied by some cheese and cured ham. I would stay again and recommend it. It's so central too. A short walk and your in the midst of it!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: StoutTraveller
Reviews.Content: For the price I would say this is a decent hotel. They have a small pool and a spa which is nice. Free breakfast that is not just croissants and cold cuts. It is actually a good breakfast and open until 10:30. It is about a 3 euro cab ride to the bottom of La Rambla so it is pretty central. Very easy to get to from the Metro (4 minute walk). The staff were very kind and helped me book tickets to an almost sold out Barcelona FC match. They lock the entrance after 2 AM but they have a doorman there waiting for the guests and manually let them in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location--Clean, Friendly, New!”
Reviews.Author: itsmeerikat
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Grums a few weeks ago and had a fantastic visit. I was impressed by the size of the room as well as the quality. I had a pleasant night's sleep each evening after wandering around the surrounding Las Ramblas area, Paral.lel, and also the Port. During the day, I often walked these areas as well because everything is so close by. Breakfast is a huge display of food--everything from cold cuts and bread to yogurt, fruit, eggs, bacon, and several other items that we had been longing for! The places we stayed prior to Hotel Grums literally had a table with croissants and butter, so this was a nice surprise! The spa area was a great afternoon retreat as well--the sauna and steam room were soothing and a dip in the pool-sized hot tub was a great way to relax after walking all over the city. The staff is very helpful, even the people who work into the wee hours of the morning. Everyone was always ready to answer questions or offer suggestions on things to see/places to go in the city. Hotel Grums is a great place to stay if you want to be near the Port of Barcelona, near some nightclubs (on Paral.lel), and want to be in a location that is convenient to get to the main sites in the city. The longest metro ride we took was to La Sagrada Familia, which is an easy ride across the downtown area. My tip: Be sure to take a business card from the hotel with the cross streets, because the hotel is less than a year old and some cab drivers weren't familiar with it yet, but once I said the street name they knew exactly where to go! :)

Reviews.Title: “A struggle to find fault with this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jewelspreston
Reviews.Content: My husband and son stayed at this hotel for a weekend break to Barcelona whilst taking in a Barca football match.We booked it through Travel Zoo at a very competitive rate. The position of the hotel was close to the harbour/marina where there are lots of good bars and eating places.The beach is a 20 minute walk away,close to Metro stations and Las Ramblas. The hotel is quite new and spotless.The decor is contemporary as you would expect.The room they stayed in was spacious with a flat screen TV and en suite shower room,the beds were very comfy! The hotel spa was excellent and of a high standard. The staff were very helpful and friendly to them as first time visitors to the city.If you are looking for a base to include a visit to the Nou Camp it is just 5 stops along the green line and the nearest Metro staton to the hotel is only 2 streets away. The breakfast included was definitely a continental style which was quite adequate but may not have been everyones cup of tea! To conclude this hotel is to be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel once I found it !!”
Reviews.Author: Sharonslinn
Reviews.Content: Took some finding but this was a lovely hotel. The room was spacious, clean and modern. The bed was comfy but two singles pushed together rather than the double I'd booked but it didn't really matter. We didn't book breakfast but there is a wonderful bakery/cafe right next door which produced the most fabulous breads and cakes, beautiful coffee and the service was friendly and fast - we were given bits of cake with our drinks which was a bonus. Las Ramblas is within easy walking distance as are the metro stations, the nearest being Paralel so we got around the city quite easily and cheaply - the metro is only a couple of euros and takes you all over the city, so we go to see most of the places we wanted to. I wasn't sure what t expect of the hotel after reading previous reviews but I was pleasantly surprised and would definately go again, it made my visit to Barcelona !!.

Reviews.Title: “Very stylish and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Anita E
Reviews.Content: Very clean and modern hotel. Wonderful breakfast in the morning, friendly staff, great location, relaxing sauna and pool, yummy bakery next door and short walk to some major sites. Very good value for the money. I would definetly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel & rooms perfect, great location, just don´t wait for the barman”
Reviews.Author: StarkyD
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location in what feels like the back streets of Barcelona. It was a very short distance to the marina, the ramblas and up to Mont Juc near the cable cars. We stayed for two nights on a deal which included access to the spa and free wifi (which compared to other reviews on here was absolutely fine, and never didn´t work). The rooms were really nice and the hotel was fine for what we needed it for. As part of the stay we were given a free drink and tapas (though as one person pointed out it wasn´t really tapas but it was free so why get your knickers in a twist). On the first night there was a barman and he seemed fine and was there for a few drinks. The second night (same guy) didn´t seem so good and kept hiding out the back. The first time we waited around 5 minutes with no sign so I went to reception to be told there was someone there, fine but they weren´t actually there so she proceeded to just call the bar and surprise surprise no one answered, well that was because no one was there! Anyway another 5 minutes and he came out but after serving everyone disappeared again to which we just decided to head out to our favourite bar Diner Apolo! Seriously go there much nicer vibe than anything I saw on the ramblas. The spa is very small but has a nice enough swimming pool/large jacuzzi with a steam room and sauna. However any more than 6 people you´d probably be getting a bit too friendly especially in the changing room! The breakfast was pretty poor but to be honest the free jagermeisters at Diner Apollo didn´t make me feel like eating much anyway lol. Overall fine for our stay and a great location

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, great locative, but small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: CristinaBolba
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed pur stat at Grums hotel. Very good services and clean ale over

Reviews.Title: “Expected better”
Reviews.Author: tyupi
Reviews.Content: We selected hotel very thoroughly. Expectations from the hotel were very high. We did not expect to receive hotel where doors of the toilets were broken, as well as lamps. We also did not know that they were charging for the swimming pool separately. Internet was not working during one week (we did not stay longer). Plus the location of the hotel was not the best as it is next to the playground for teenagers and it is quite remote place especially in the evenings. I wonder how it became one of the best hotels in the previous year... Good luck

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed- Not a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Ninoxo
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 2 night stay at Grums and unfortunately have to say I was not impressed by this hotel. Problems expereinced at the hotel included food ordered through room service not being delivered, inadequate bedding, rude cleaning staff, and absent staff throughout the hotel (in the bar/restaurant and the spa/pool area), and no information included within the room such as hotel information, room service, local area information etc. This definitely is not a 4 star hotel, please do not think I am being overly critical - it is simply an average 3 star hotel. Other reviews have mentioned the surrounding area being run down, it isn't the best area but seemed to be trouble free. Some positives about the hotel- the reception staff were friendly and helpful. the location is good we managed to get the metro from airport to the hotel hassle free, and it is a short walk to the nearest port (port vell i believe), and very close to las ramblas. For a short holiday this hotel just about does the job, for a longer stay I would reccomend you look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: FireSpitter
Reviews.Content: The hotel room's modern decor is very nice, room & bed is clean, location is convenient (Metro & La Rambla is closeby), staff speaks English but the following prevented me from giving it full marks:- 1) Do not rely on the door to close by itself (Although there is a gadget to assist this). The door does not close fully and everytime I had to ensure that the door is fully closed by pulling the handle. My room is 314 in case you need to check. 2) Besides location, my next most important criteria is free wifi. I was surprised that I had to ask for it before I will be given a login id and password as they did not provide this during my check in. Even then, the wifi worked for 15 minutes on my iPhone (In my room) and stopped working altogether after that. Tried using my laptop for work purposes and it didn't even work at all. I suspect you may have to use it in their lounge instead of the room. 3) Was not able to use the bathtub at all as the drainhole could not be shut. Shower is fine though (Obviously).

Reviews.Title: “Stay there if you have a next day cruise”
Reviews.Author: Marado12
Reviews.Content: This is the most convenient hotel if you start a cruise in Barcelona. Clean modern big bedrooms what a nice start for a cruise time. The location is just perfect and a very good quality for the money you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish.well located”
Reviews.Author: vickyfisher
Reviews.Content: Clean modern hotel with great breakfast & friendly staff.Spacious room,Spa small .Location great close to many interesting areas but in quiet road,Would certainly go again.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, economical, well located”
Reviews.Author: DoctorDee69
Reviews.Content: Grums is a beautiful hotel. Stylish, clean and modern. It is very conveniently located for all of Barcelona's many attractions. The staff, when we checked in were polite, efficient and spoke good English. Though to my mind, anyone who marks a hotel down because the staff do not speak English, or the TV does not have English language channels, cannot really be considered a traveller... Just a slack-jawed tourist! Still, the feedback seems to have worked. Grums TV (Samsung flat screens) now has a selection of channels spouting bland pap in English. But why anyone would travel to Barcelona to watch TV they could see at home baffles me. The area around the Hotel, described by some as dangerous, is lively and colourful. It is in no way dangerous. I suspect those who describe it as such only feel truly safe in their own back yards.

Reviews.Title: “All Good at Grums”
Reviews.Author: Neils5560
Reviews.Content: We approached this with some trepidation after some of the reviews. Should not have worried. Rooms excellent, room service excellent, reception staff friendly and spoke good english. Breakfast in the cafe next door is just brilliant. Great location. Would recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Designer hotel in quiet part of town - recommended”
Reviews.Author: snowydog
Reviews.Content: We stopped here for three nights and chose primarily on price and location. First impressions were positive, a smart modern glass reception area and a superb clean, modern room. The bed was huge, nicely firm and supportive with top quality sheets and pillows. Our room, 413, overlooked the central courtyard and had great lighting, mini fridge, free in-room safe and TV, although as others have mentioned there is NO english language channel. Location wise the hotel is out of the central tourist area in a largely residential area called Poble Sec two just off Avenida del Paralelo and 5 minutes walk from both the nearest metro station (Parallel), the Naval museum and the port. It is also perfectly located for exploring the Olympic park on Montjuic mountain overlooking the city. TIP**- if you want to avoid the overpriced tourist traps in the old town head 10 minutes west from the hotel to a street called Carrer de Blai where you will find lots of little tapas bars where all the locals congregate in the evening to pass the time of day and put the world to rights whilst their kids play football and ride their bikes - a real taste of the true Barcelona and with tapas/montadito dishes priced at around 1 - 1.50 EUR each you can spend a great evening out for less than 20 EUR for two of you! However if you are planning on spending all your time in the old town area of Barri Gotic or Borne to the north of Las Ramblas then you will need to factor in a 15-20 min walk each day. With regard to the safety aspect mentioned by some previous reviewers I must say that at no point did we feel unsafe of threatened in any way. The road leading to the hotel from the Parallel metro is well lit and overlooked by apartment buildings all the way and although we did see a few people sleeping rough in the park, they are easily avoided by sticking to the road and like any big city you just need to use some common sense. Our rate included breakfast served from 7am through to 10am each day on the mezzanine level with access to the central courtyard. Catering for its prime european clientele, it comprised lots of cold meats, salamis, cheese, pastries, cakes, donuts and fruit and although there was a small bacon, sausage and scambled egg selection, this was pretty poor and not a patch on the delightful continental selection. However at 11 EUR pp it is not particularly good value and if you are not on an inclusive rate then I would strongly suggest going next door to the lovely looking bakery/coffee shop. Access to the gym and spa is now charged at 6 EUR pp - maybe in reaction to some of the previous comments! The gym area is very small consisting of just a treadmill, a couple of bikes and an area for floor exercises, whilst the pool was about 10m long with a steam room and sauna just off to one side. As I had the place to myself there was plenty of space and the area was great for a relaxing few hours after some hard sightseeing. On the negative side, my biggest gripe was the lack of the free wi-fi that never actually worked and the fact that in some areas the hotel felt unfinished with loose and badly aligned fittings. However overall I would recommend this hotel if you can get it at a good price and are looking for a comfortable modern quiet hotel outside of the main tourist areas.

Reviews.Title: “Minimalist”
Reviews.Author: peecee007
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose this hotel completely blind after leaving it till the last minute to book a hotel in Barcelona before we got on the cruise ship. We stayed 5 nights. The room was very clean, very modern with a really comfy bed. Large shower head was floppy, but we managed. Good location close to paral el and a short walk to la rambla. We were room only so can't comment on the food and drink. Big plus for us was that there is a coffee and cake shop next door and a Lidl supermarket just around the corner. Free wi-fi, free safe. We lost our room key, was immediately replaced, no hassle. Has a spa at extra charge but didn't try it. Only criticism..... no way of making a brew. Price quoted was the exact price we paid. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel near the port”
Reviews.Author: Mallech
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for one night before leaving to travel further north. Stylish room with excellent facilities. Great bed, linen and very clean. Guess hotel is quite new so wear and tear is at a minimum. Good area if you are going to the port but not so good if you are just a tourist. Although not far from las ramblas the surrounding neighbourhood is a bit rough and dodgy especially late at night with people sleeping rough in nearby park. I suggest you come and go by taxi late at night. No local bars or restaurants so not really a tourist area.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for cruise port”
Reviews.Author: jsdmr2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night before a recent cruise. The hotel is situated down a side street just below the Montjuic park and is about 200m from Parallel. The reception staff spoke good English and my booking was handled courteously and efficiently. Our room was spotless and overlooked a central courtyard area( outside breakfast area and other buildings.). The decor was very modern with useful lighting features( individual reading lights). The bathroom had a powerful shower although oddly the sink was in the bedroom not the bathroom. On the lower ground floor was a small swimming pool, a sauna and a steam room ( although the last of these was out of order). There is also a very small gym. At a cost of 85 euros this was good value for Barcelona given its proximity to Las Ramblas and the cruise port and we are considering returning for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, design and clean”
Reviews.Author: alexfrombrussels
Reviews.Content: Stay there three nights with my girl friend, it was a present from her. Hotel is quiet brand new i guess, room are very new and clean, modern, u can have the free wifi, nce modern shower and nice bed, not that center but u have a metro station close by. NICE PLACE

Reviews.Title: “ONE OF THE BEST HOTELS I HAVE STAYED IN IN EUROPE!”
Reviews.Author: StefT
Reviews.Content: POSITIVES: The rooms were absolutely fantastic, both from a design and amenity perspective. They were very comfortable and the linen was out of this world! Every little thing in the rooms was well thought through and the comfort was superior to many hotels in Greece asking for more money! The breakfast was also really good; best we had on our European trip. NEGATIVES: The front-desk staff were not too polite and were unprofessional; Also, their command of English for a hotel such as this was quite poor/disappointing. EURO 10, per person to use the swimming pool??? Now that's a first! And such a small thing that can put you off such an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel I would stay again”
Reviews.Author: broooce
Reviews.Content: Hotel looks ok from front, check in easy. Room 115 is modern and clean, tv but no eng speaking channels. Shower no bath, in room safe. Three of us in room and the sofa bed was already made up, a reasonable size room for euro hotel. 5-10 minutes walk from Port and Las Ramblas, immediate area not pretty. There is a nearby Aldi and garage for drinks and snacks. Free wifi but I could not get working on iPhone or iPad.  Taxi from airport cost €30. Did not try restaurant so don't know about quality there. Overall a reasonable hotel I would stay again but would not be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Cancelled our reservation and sent us to another hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amanda G
Reviews.Content: After traveling for 20 hours we arrive at the hotel for them to give us a bogus excuse about the computer system being down so they could not check us in but they reserved a room in a hotel around the corner. My husband and I were perplexed especially as the people who came in after us were checked in! I wish the staff did not feel the need to lie, if they overbooked they could have just said so. Worst part is they said they would pay for a taxi for us to get to the hotel they booked but conveniently the phones were not working and instead we had to haul all our luggage to the hotel. This was difficult as my husband and I were going on a cruise and then to the Canary Islands so we had a lot of luggage! Thank goodness the hotel we were sent to was The Tryp Apolo. The staff at the Tryp Apolo treated us so well. We got a late checkout and they went above and beyond to organise the Gaudi Tour for us before we went on our cruise. Do not bother staying at Grums, there are better hotels to stay at like the Tryp Apolo.

Reviews.Title: “Completely Deceiving”
Reviews.Author: lkiewiet
Reviews.Content: We booked a 'urban' style room for 7 nights in August. I used booking.com and referred to the hotels direct website for pictures of the style of room. (even booking.com shows the rooms as deceiving). The urban room was alot smaller in size than my perception from their website. Their was no sofa area in the urban room. Spoke with the Mananger 'Oscar' who initially called my comments 'nonsense' and he would not offer or negotiate or even concede that the pictures on his hotels website are deceiving. Also the official checkin time is 1400 but we were told to come back in 2 hours as the room was not available. The woman on the front desk did not smile as the staff were under alot of stress. Obviously their is an internal problem with management. The hotel also says free internet is available in the 'entire hotel'. Another deception. The internet does not work on any of our 3 devices. Be also mindful that this hotel is situated in a very scummy area of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and elegant Hotel with Style.”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Sasita
Reviews.Content: I loved the interior of the room, especially the comfy bedding. It's perfect for people who go for the details and avoid business hotels. The huge balcony is perfect to have a little gathering with friends. The air-conditioner saved our nights and the WiFi worked very well. Very friendly hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Went to another hotel, no airco, 30 degrees in the room”
Reviews.Author: BelgiumFlyer
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Grums is nicely situated just next to the port of Barcelona. Most of guests are departing on a cruise. So did we. We had a booking for 1 night and an other booking for 2 nights after our cruise for 2 adults and 2 children. Rooms have a good size and are clean. Babycot was provided. Nespresso machine didn't work, only 2 capsules in the room. Breakfast is rather poor. Little indoor swimming pool where you have to pay. Free internet was broken. The big problem is the air conditioning in the hotel. It was 30 degrees in our room and impossible to cool. As we arrived late at night, after moving around to other rooms who had 30 degrees as well, we stayed for one night. It was horrible. We negotiated with the reception staff to have a cool room upon arrival the next week. Unfortunately the airco still wasn't fixed the week after, so we moved to another hotel on our own expense. We saw a lot of unhappy guests. I would rate it a 3 star hotel instead of a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “just wish we were still there”
Reviews.Author: sarylu
Reviews.Content: myself and my partner have got back just this morning from a stay at the hotel grums in Barcelona in celebration of my partners birthday, and I couldnt wait to review it! I had paid for a basic room, but on arrival we were upgraded to a superior room (401).The hotel exceeded expectations, the room was very lovely, with an incredibly comfy bed. The decor was very modern and utterly deserves the 4* rating! The communal areas of the hotel were gorgeous too, lots of different colours and textures that make it really cozy. I would also like to say that the reception staff were great, if we wanted for anything, they had an "of course" attitude. This hotel is in a perfect location, just steps away to the right of the hotel is the beautiful montjuic park, and less than 10 minutes walk to the left is las ramblas and the harbour. Absolutely gutted that our trip is over, we will be back very soon to Barcelona, and simply would not hesitate to go there again.

Reviews.Title: “not a terrible choice”
Reviews.Author: jmdintpa
Reviews.Content: the hotel itself was very nice. clean, new and no problems with noise. there was confusion on using the spa. i paid on the hotel website 10 euro for a spa pass to just use the steam room , sauna etc. however when i arrived i was advised that was for just one day. no where on the site when i booked did it advise of this. when i asked about going ahead and paying for the spa for my entire stay the front desk seemed completely confused by this. my friend speaks fluent spanish so i know it was not a language issue. it just seems the process is confusing for customers and staff alike. otherwise the staff were fine. the hotel location is just ok. there really isnt much around but its all within walking distance... although if i go back i will choose a hotel closer to tourist spots as there are no restaraunts bars etc around. we did a day on the tourist hop on hop off bus and it was great. we used the red bus it was not crowded and offered a fun way to see the entire city instead of using the underground to get around. i saw many reports of pick pockets and such in barcelona but had no issues or did not see anyone else with this problem. of course just like anyplace pay attention use a money belt and you should be fine. all in all the hotel was fine but due to location i would probably not pay there price to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Please Avoid!!”
Reviews.Author: roamer65
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an overnight at Grums Hotel Barcelona. Choose this hotel as it was close to the Port of Barcelona and was the cheapest 4* in that area. Absolutely appalling hotel. Set in a very unsafe looking area, completely overlooked in every direction by residential flats, very unsafe to walk in area at night. Hotel itself is aesthetically very appealing, beautifully decorated inside but with absolutely no facilities worth mentioning. We had problem with temperature of room (28 degrees). Went to reception 6 times and each time was told problem was being addressed. It was NEVER addressed and we spent the whole night with the windows wide open which meant that the noise of the street music and traffic not to mention the hassle of the mosquitos was unbearable. I complained about the heat in the room etc but there was only one young receptionist covering every eventuality and no manager available until next morning!!!! We were charged the full rate of E150 and offered complimentary breakfast as compensation! Absolutely disgraceful place please do not be tempted to book this hotel because it is described as central or close to the port if going on a cruise, you can find much much better. Perhaps a more appropriate name would be Hotel Grim rather than Grum!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a city break”
Reviews.Author: Robbyrs
Reviews.Content: We went here in the weekend of the Champions League final 2011. The hotel was just a few months old. Our room was on the 1st floor (room 111 for 3 people). There was a sofa bed in the room. The room was in general very nice, good bed, bathroom with toilet was good. There was no tub in our bathroom but the shower was excellent. Our room was located at the garden side of the hotel and also our view was on the garden. We did not booked breakfast, just about 5 meters next to the hotel there is a sandwich shop where u can have breakfast. The food there in good and cheap. And just around the corner of the hotel u find 2 supermarkets. If u want some food and drinks for in your room. The location of the hotel is also good, less than 10 min walking distance from the Rambla, 15 min from airport with taxi. On walking distance, 5 min to metro. 10 min from the port and new shopping mall. The hotel lobby is quite small, but the interior is really nice. The wi-fi inside was good, my connection with my iphone was quite good and fast. The spa facilities was closed when we went there. A few comments: for my feeling the hotel is very understaffed, the reception staff are not quite interested in their guests, in the room there isn’t any information about the hotel itself, restaurant, room service etc., the sink is not inside the bathroom but in the room itself. TV with only 1 English channel. But overall the hotel is good, location is good, situated in a quite area.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Cool Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travel_mole09
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a trip to Barcelona, The service was great the hotel is very cool and is located fantastically for access to transport. We had breakfast in the morning which was very good, unfortunately we did not have time to use the Spa but is something that we definitely we will do next time. I can not wait to be back, thank you for making it so special for us.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel near main area.”
Reviews.Author: Speedy1224
Reviews.Content: Just finished staying here and was a good hotel, 10 mins from las ramblas and near the port. Room was clean and comfy but could have done with information pack. A recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel with an amazing location”
Reviews.Author: mcdines
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 4 night stay at the hotel. I made my decision based on the location of the hotel and I was not disappointed. A t-10 metro card purchased at the airport (be aware of pick pockets!) to Barcelona sants station and then another metro to paral-lel brings you within a very short walking distance (<500m) from the hotel itself. The front of the hotel was still being completed by adding a veranda to the car park entry, however this caused little inconvenience. Once inside the hotel the decor is to a good standard and especially for a traveller from Britain an effective air conditioning system in the rooms. We didn't use the restaurant or spa facilities and didn't have any special requests to make so can't comment on these. However being within 10 minutes walking distance of the port, las ramblas and the 2 largest metro lines in the city and having no problems at all with our stay Hotel Grums definitely comes recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and quiet...”
Reviews.Author: rangerfan23
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two-night stay at Hotel Grums Barcelona and we were pleased with our selection. We chose the hotel because of its location near La Ramblas and near to the cruise ship port. Friends of ours were joining us for our second night and we off on a cruise the next day so location was important to us. The front desk was very accommodating when I asked if our other party could be put near us in the hotel, which was done without a problem. In fact they put them right next door! They offered us a map of the city and gave us highlights of what to see/do. The rooms were big and comfortable by European standards with very cold air conditioning, clean beds, hot water and a mini fridge. We couldn't fault our stay at this hotel and would recommend it to anyone!
